parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural

str2: Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.
Without honor, despised. (negatively) unhonoured or (positively) dishonoured.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To place or put around, clothe; fig: I bestow, confer. From peri and tithemi; to place around; by implication, to present.
From peri; superabundant or superior; by implication, excessive; adverbially violently; neuter preeminence.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Unseemly, indecent. Properly, shapeless, i.e. inelegant.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From peri; superabundant or superior; by implication, excessive; adverbially violently; neuter preeminence.
Decorum, becomingness, embellishment. From euschemon; decorousness.
